alert.note: Alert for Covington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 5:59PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Alabama, including the following county, Covington. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 558 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated a band of showers and thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Andalusia, Opp, Stanley, Sanford, Babbie, Horn Hill, Carolina, Wiggins, Red Oak, Onycha, Eoda, Beck, Beulah, Blairs, Estothel, County Line and Falco. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
